items.title: Conduct Search Engine Discovery and Reconnaissance for Information Leakage
items.caption: OTG-INFO-001, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Query search engines for leaked credentials, configurations, or documents via misindexing.
items.tools: bbot, dorky, Censys, Google Dorks, Shodan

items.title: Fingerprint Web Server
items.caption: OTG-INFO-002, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify server, CMS, or database software and version to exploit CVEs or misconfigurations.

items.title: Review Webserver Metafiles for Information Leakage
items.caption: OTG-INFO-003, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Check robots.txt, sitemap.xml and identify <META> Tags from website for exposed endpoints or directories.

items.title: Enumerate Applications on Webserver
items.caption: if in scope OTG-INFO-004, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Find applications hosted in the webserver (Virtual hosts/Subdomain), non-standard ports, DNS zone transfers to expand the attack surface.

items.title: Review Webpage Comments and Metadata for Information Leakage
items.caption: OTG-INFO-005, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Analyze HTML and JavaScript for leaked API keys, credentials, or endpoints.

items.title: Identify application entry points
items.caption: OTG-INFO-006, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify forms, APIs, or parameters for injection or logic vulnerabilities.

items.title: Map execution paths through application
items.caption: OTG-INFO-007, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Map application workflows to uncover hidden or unprotected routes.

items.title: Fingerprint Web Application Framework
items.caption: OTG-INFO-008, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify the web application framework or CMS by examining HTTP headers, cookies, source code, and specific file/folder structures for characteristic indicators.

items.title: Fingerprint Web Application
items.caption: OTG-INFO-009, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify the web application and version to determine known vulnerabilities and the appropriate exploits.

items.title: Map Application Architecture
items.caption: OTG-INFO-010, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify application architecture including Web language, WAF, Reverse proxy, Application Server, Backend Database

items.title: Test Network/Infrastructure Configuration
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-001, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis, Assess Application Hosting
items.description: Assess infrastructure interactions and configuration management for software, backend DB servers, WebDAV, and FTP to uncover known vulnerabilities.

items.title: Test Application Platform Configuration
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-002, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Testing application platform configuration involves identifying default installation paths, handling server errors, enforcing minimal privileges, and managing software logging.

items.title: Test File Extensions Handling for Sensitive Information
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-003, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Locate crucial files and information with the following extensions: .asa, .inc, .sql, .zip, .tar, .pdf, .txt, and others.

items.title: Backup and Unreferenced Files for Sensitive Information
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-004, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Examine JavaScript code, comments, cache, and backup files (.old, .bak, .inc, .src). Utilize filename guessing to discover additional files.

items.title: Enumerate Infrastructure and Application Admin Interfaces
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-005, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Perform directory and file enumeration. Extract comments and links from source code, specifically looking for administrative interfaces (e.g., /admin, /administrator, /backoffice, /backend). Investigate alternative server ports, such as Tomcat running on port 8080.
items.tools: Burp Suite, ffuf, gau, kiterunner, LinkFinder

items.title: Test HTTP Methods
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Probe risky HTTP methods (e.g., OPTIONS, TRACE, PUT) for unauthorized access.

items.title: Test HTTP Strict Transport Security
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check the HTTP response headers from the web server to identify the presence and details of the Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header.

items.title: Test RIA cross domain policy
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Test crossdomain.xml and clientaccesspolicy.xml for permissive data access.

items.title: Test for Subdomain Takeover
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-010
items.description: Exploit dangling DNS records for subdomain takeover.

items.title: Test Cloud Storage
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-011
items.description: Check AWS S3 buckets, GCP Cloud Storage, and Azure Blob Storage for public data exposure.
items.tools: awscli, Azure CLI, CloudFox, GCPBucketBrute, s3recon

items.title: Web Cache Deception
items.description: Cache sensitive pages as public resources via path manipulation.

items.title: Web Cache Poisoning
items.description: Poison CDN or service worker cache with malicious content.

items.title: Testing Content Security Policy (CSP)
items.description: Assess the implementation of the Content Security Policy to ensure it effectively mitigates risks of cross-site scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks.

items.title: Test Role Definitions
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Validate the system roles defined within the application by creating a permission matrix.

items.title: Test User Registration Process
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Verify that the identity requirements for user registration are aligned with business and security requirements

items.title: Test Account Provisioning Process
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Identify the roles with user provisioning capabilities and the permissible scope of the accounts they can provision.

items.title: Testing for Account Enumeration and Guessable User Account
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check login and forgot password mechanisms for generic error leakage and return code vulnerabilities, and attempt to enumerate valid users through direct methods or timing exploits.

items.title: Testing for Weak or unenforced username policy
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: User account naming conventions often follow predictable patterns (e.g., initials and last name), making valid account names easily guessable.

items.title: Test Permissions of Guest/Training Accounts
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Evaluate if guest and training account access permissions consistently align with the defined access policy.

items.title: Test Account Suspension/Resumption Process
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Verify the alignment of user registration identity requirements with business and security needs, and subsequently validate the entire registration process.

items.title: Testing for Credentials Transported over an Encrypted Channel
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-001, WAHHM - Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Check the referrer whether itâ€™s HTTP or HTTPs. Sending data through HTTP and HTTPS.

items.title: Testing for default credentials
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Test for default credentials in common applications and default passwords assigned to new accounts.

items.title: Testing for Weak Lockout Mechanism
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Evaluate the strength of the account lockout against password guessing and the security of the account unlock process.

items.title: Testing for bypassing authentication schema
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Force browsing (/admin/main.php, /page.asp?authenticated=yes), Parameter Modification, Session ID prediction, SQL Injection
items.tools: Arjun, Browser, Burp Suite, kiterunner, Param-miner, ZAP

items.title: Test remember password functionality
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check application cookies for password storage (ensuring they are not in plaintext but hashed) and verify the autocomplete=off attribute on password fields.

items.title: Testing for Browser cache weakness
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-006, WAHHM - Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Test for browser history vulnerabilities after logout and examine HTTP response headers for proper cache control directives (e.g., Cache-Control: no-cache)
items.tools: Browser, Burp Suite, ZAP, Firefox add-on CacheViewer2

items.title: Testing for Weak password policy
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Assess the application's resistance to dictionary-based brute-force attacks by evaluating password length, complexity, reuse restrictions, and aging requirements.

items.title: Testing for Weak security question/answer
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Test password reset questions for inherent weakness (pre-generated, self-generated) and susceptibility to brute-force attacks due to unlimited attempts.

items.title: Testing for weak password change or reset functionalities
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-009, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Test password reset for plaintext password display, insecure email transmission, and missing random tokens, and assess password change for old password requirement and CSRF vulnerability.

items.title: Testing for Weaker authentication in alternative channel
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-010, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Understand the primary mechanism and Identify other channels (Mobile App, Call center, SSO)

items.title: Single Sign-On Misconfigurations
items.description: Exploit OAuth or OpenID Connect flaws (e.g., redirect URI tampering)

items.title: Testing for 2FA/MFA
items.description: Attempt to bypass the implemented two-factor authentication to identify potential weaknesses.

items.title: Testing for Password Reset Token Exposure to Third-Party Domains
items.description: Check if password reset tokens are exposed to third-party domains via referrer headers or other methods.

items.title: Testing for Reusable Password Reset Tokens
items.description: Determine if password reset tokens can be used multiple times.

items.title: Testing Directory traversal/file include
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Test for Dot-Dot-Slash (../), Directory Traversal, Local File Inclusion (LFI), and Remote File Inclusion (RFI) vulnerabilities.
items.tools: Arjun, Burp Suite, ffuf, Param-miner, Wfuzz, ZAP

items.title: Testing for bypassing authorization schema
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Test for the ability to access resources without authentication, bypass Access Control Lists (ACLs), and perform forceful browsing to restricted areas (e.g., /admin/adduser.jsp)

items.title: Testing for Privilege Escalation
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Escalate privileges via parameter tampering or logic flaws.

items.title: Testing for Insecure Direct Object References
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Access objects by manipulating identifiers (e.g., user IDs)

items.title: Testing for Bypassing Session Management Schema
items.caption: OTG-SESS-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Predictable SessionIDs transmitted without encryption expose a vulnerability to interception and potential brute-force attacks, leading to authentication bypass.

items.title: Testing for Cookies attributes
items.caption: OTG-SESS-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check HTTPOnly and Secure flag expiration, inspect for sensitive data.

items.title: Testing for Session Fixation
items.caption: OTG-SESS-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: The application doesn't renew the cookie after a successful user authentication.

items.title: Testing for Exposed Session Variables
items.caption: OTG-SESS-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Unencrypted and reused session tokens sent via GET requests expose sessions to easy interception and hijacking.

items.title: Testing for Cross Site Request Forgery
items.caption: OTG-SESS-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Predictable URLs combined with missing CSRF tokens allow attackers to directly trigger actions on behalf of logged-in users.

items.title: Testing for logout functionality
items.caption: OTG-SESS-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Verify session invalidation server-side and across SSO after logout to prevent reuse.

items.title: Test Session Timeout
items.caption: OTG-SESS-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check session timeout, after the timeout has passed, all session tokens should be destroyed or be unusable.

items.title: Testing for Session puzzling
items.caption: OTG-SESS-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Reusing session variables for multiple purposes allows attackers to manipulate application flow by accessing pages in unintended sequences.

items.title: Test for Concurrent Sessions
items.description: Check how the application manages multiple active sessions for the same account. Ensure it prevents risks like session hijacking and improper session handling.

items.title: Test for Session Validity After Permission Change
items.description: Check if sessions remain valid when user permissions are changed.

items.title: JSON Web Token (JWT) Attacks
items.description: Check the security of JWTs by ensuring strong signing algorithms, preventing tampering, and protecting sensitive data. Verify secure transmission, token expiration, and revocation practices.

items.title: Testing for Reflected Cross Site Scripting
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Bypass input validation and leverage HTTP Parameter Pollution to inject XSS payloads, circumventing standard XSS detection vectors.

items.title: Testing for Stored Cross Site Scripting
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Identify and exploit persistent cross-site scripting vectors within input handling and HTML rendering to achieve arbitrary JavaScript execution across multiple authenticated user contexts.

items.title: Testing for HTTP Verb Tampering
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Forge non-standard HTTP requests to probe and circumvent URL-based authentication and authorization mechanisms.

items.title: Testing for HTTP Parameter pollution
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Identify bypasses in input validation and filtering mechanisms via HTTP Parameter Pollution (HPP) to inject malicious payloads through user-supplied data.

items.title: Testing for SQL Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Identify and exploit SQL injection vulnerabilities (Union, Boolean, Error-based, Out-of-band, Time-delay) to achieve unauthorized database access and data manipulation.

items.title: Testing for Oracle
items.description: Discover PL/SQL web application endpoints, leverage PL/SQL packages for access, bypass exclusion mechanisms, and exploit SQL injection vulnerabilities.

items.title: Testing for MySQL
items.description: Identify target MySQL version and leverage single quote injection via information_schema to achieve arbitrary file read/write capabilities.

items.title: Testing for SQL Server
items.description: Leverage comment operators, query separators, and stored procedures (like xp_cmdshell) to inject and execute arbitrary commands within the database.

items.title: Testing PostgreSQL
items.description: Determine that the backend database engine is PostgreSQL by using the :: cast operator. Read/Write file, Shell Injection (OS command)

items.title: Testing for MS Access
items.description: Exploit error-based SQL injection (via GROUP BY) to enumerate database columns and extract schema information using targeted fuzzing lists.

items.title: Testing for NoSQL injection
items.description: Identify NoSQL database vulnerabilities by injecting special characters (' " \ ; { } ) and reserved keywords to manipulate query logic and potentially gain unauthorized access.

items.title: Testing for LDAP Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Actively examining LDAP endpoints using specialized inputs to detect exploitable injection flaws that could lead to unauthorized data exposure or manipulation.

items.title: Testing for ORM Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze application data flow to detect injection points where crafted input can alter ORM-generated queries, enabling unintended database interactions.

items.title: Testing for XML Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze XML parsing mechanisms for vulnerabilities where maliciously structured XML input can be injected to manipulate application logic or extract sensitive data.

items.title: Testing for SSI Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-009, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Examine .shtml resources for server-side include processing flaws that allow the injection of control characters and directives to achieve arbitrary code execution or sensitive file access on the server.

items.title: Testing for XPath Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-010, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze XML path processing for vulnerabilities where crafted input, such as single quotes and logical OR conditions (e.g., ' or '1'='1), can be injected to induce errors revealing underlying structure or bypass authentication logic.

items.title: Testing for IMAP/SMTP Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-011, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze mail client data handling for vulnerabilities where crafted input with special characters can be injected into IMAP/SMTP commands (headers, body, footer), potentially leading to unintended mail server actions or information disclosure.
items.tools: Burp Suite, netcat, nmap IMAP/SMTP NSE script, ZAP

items.title: Testing for Code Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-012, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze input fields for vulnerabilities where the injection of OS commands (e.g., ; system('id')) can lead to arbitrary command execution on the underlying system.

items.title: Testing for Local File Inclusion
items.description: Analyze application file handling for vulnerabilities where manipulated input with dot-dot-slash sequences (../../) or PHP wrappers (php://filter) can be used to access sensitive local files.

items.title: Testing for Remote File Inclusion
items.description: Analyze web applications for vulnerabilities where external URLs provided as parameters (e.g., ?file=http://attacker.com/malicious_page) can be included and executed by the server, leading to arbitrary code execution or data compromise.

items.title: Testing for Command Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-013, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze application input handling to identify vulnerabilities where crafted payloads leveraging OS-specific syntax (e.g., ``;,|+`) can be injected to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the underlying server.

items.title: Testing for Buffer overflow
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-014, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Testing for heap overflow vulnerability
Testing for stack overflow vulnerability
Testing for format string vulnerability

items.title: Testing for Heap overflow
items.description: Examining dynamic memory allocation to detect if writing beyond allocated heap buffers can corrupt data structures, potentially enabling arbitrary code execution.

items.title: Testing for Stack overflow
items.description: Investigating function call mechanisms to find if excessive data written to the stack can overwrite return addresses or local variables, potentially leading to control-flow redirection.

items.title: Testing for Format string
items.description: Probing input handling with format specifiers to determine if attacker-controlled strings can be used to read from or write to arbitrary memory locations.

items.title: Testing for Incubated Vulnerabilities
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-015, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze application components (file upload, data handling, server configurations) for latent vulnerabilities like Stored XSS and SQL/XPath Injection, and identifying misconfigurations that could be exploited over time.

items.title: Testing for HTTP Response Splitting
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-016, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze HTTP header handling for vulnerabilities allowing the injection of CRLF sequences (%0d%0a) to manipulate server responses and potentially conduct cross-user attacks.

items.title: Testing for HTTP Request Smuggling
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-016, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze backend HTTP processing for discrepancies in request parsing that allow the injection and misrouting of subsequent requests.

items.title: Testing for Host Header Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-017
items.description: Analyze application handling of the Host header for vulnerabilities allowing manipulation to conduct actions like cache poisoning or redirect users to malicious sites.

items.title: Testing for Server-side Template Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-018
items.description: Analyze server-side template rendering for vulnerabilities allowing injection of malicious code within template syntax to achieve remote code execution or data exfiltration.

items.title: Testing for Server-Side Request Forgery
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-019
items.description: Probe application functionality that handles external URLs to identify vulnerabilities allowing unauthorized server-initiated requests.

items.title: Testing for Insecure Deserialization
items.description: Analyze application endpoints that deserialize data for vulnerabilities allowing manipulation of serialized objects to achieve arbitrary code execution or other malicious outcomes.

items.title: Testing for GraphQL
items.description: Assess GraphQL implementations for vulnerabilities related to introspection, denial-of-service via complex queries, and insecure field access.
items.tools: Burp Suite (GraphQL Raider), graphql-cop, GraphQLmap, InQL

items.title: Analysis of Error Codes
items.caption: OTG-ERR-001, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Examine error messages and handling mechanisms for disclosure of sensitive data, internal system details, or potential for denial-of-service.

items.title: Analysis of Stack Traces
items.caption: OTG-ERR-002, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Check application responses for exposed stack traces that could disclose sensitive internal information.

items.title: Testing for 403 forbidden bypass
items.description: Test various techniques like HTTP verb manipulation, URL encoding, directory traversal, header manipulation, path fuzzing, case manipulation, adding a trailing slash, and attaching a URL fragment to bypass 403 Forbidden errors

items.title: Testing for Weak SSL/TSL Ciphers, Insufficient Transport Layer Protection
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Identify SSL service, Identify weak ciphers/protocols (ie. RC4, BEAST, CRIME, POODLE)

items.title: Testing for Padding Oracle
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Evaluate application behavior across three ciphertext states: valid decryption, decryption resulting in errors (non-padding), and padding-related decryption failures.
items.tools: Burp Suite (Padding Oracle Hunter), PadBuster, python-paddingoracle, POET

items.title: Testing for Sensitive information sent via unencrypted channels
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Ensure encrypted transport for sensitive information: authentication secrets, session tokens, and protected data (e.g., PCI, customer records)

items.title: Testing for Weak Encryption
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Identify weak encryption algorithms (e.g., MD5, SHA-1) in storage or transit.

items.title: Test Business Logic Data Validation
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-001, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Evaluate business logic for proper data validation implementation, covering range checks, format validation, consistency checks, and adherence to business rules.

items.title: Test Ability to Forge Requests
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-002, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Test the ability to forge HTTP requests to assess potential vulnerabilities related to request manipulation and unauthorized actions.

items.title: Test Integrity Checks
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-003, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Validate data integrity across application components (inputs, databases, logs) by verifying expected data types, formats, and authorized modifications based on business logic. Attempt to inject invalid data and unauthorized operations.

items.title: Test for Process Timing
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-004, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Exploit race conditions via timing attacks.

items.title: Test Number of Times a Function Can be Used Limits
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-005, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Attempt to exceed defined rate limits on critical endpoints to verify proper implementation and resilience.

items.title: Testing for the Circumvention of Work Flows
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-006, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Skip workflow steps (e.g., payment) for unauthorized access.

items.title: Test Defenses Against Application Mis-use
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-007, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Test for vulnerabilities allowing abuse of application functionality (e.g., excessive resource consumption, unintended workflows).

items.title: Test Upload of Unexpected File Types
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-008, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Test Upload of Unexpected File Types to assess the application's handling of non-standard file uploads and prevent potential security risks like remote code execution.

items.title: Test Upload of Malicious Files
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-009, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description: Test Upload of Malicious Files to Assess Potential for Remote Code Execution, Data Exposure, or System Compromise.

items.title: Testing for Stripped EXIF Geolocation Metadata in Uploaded Images
items.description: Check uploaded images for unstripped EXIF metadata leaking sensitive data.

items.title: Testing for CSV Injection
items.description: Check for formula injection vulnerabilities in CSV export functionality.

items.title: Testing for Lack of Password Confirmation
items.description: Verify absence of password confirmation prompts for sensitive actions: Account deletion, email change, password change, and 2FA management.

items.title: Testing for DOM-based Cross-Site Scripting
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-001, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Analyze client-side JavaScript for vulnerabilities where attacker-controlled data in the DOM can be manipulated to execute malicious scripts.

items.title: Testing for JavaScript Execution
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Test for the ability to inject and execute malicious JavaScript.

items.title: Testing for HTML Injection
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Check input fields and website areas for the ability to inject arbitrary HTML code.

items.title: Testing for Client-Side URL Redirect
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze client-side code for manipulable redirect parameters that could lead to phishing or malicious site redirects.

items.title: Testing for CSS Injection
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyze CSS handling for vulnerabilities allowing injection of malicious styles to alter page rendering or extract sensitive information.

items.title: Testing for Client Side Resource Manipulation
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Assess the application's resilience against attacks that involve manipulating client-side resources to achieve malicious outcomes.

items.title: Testing Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-007, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Verify proper CORS configuration to prevent unauthorized cross-domain data access.

items.title: Testing for Clickjacking
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-009, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Determine if the website implements sufficient client-side defenses (e.g., X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy) to prevent rendering within a frame controlled by a malicious site.

items.title: Testing WebSockets
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-010, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Check WebSocket endpoints by inspecting ws:// or wss:// URI scheme for proper authorization and data handling.

items.title: Testing Web Messaging
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-011, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Evaluate JavaScript Web Messaging implementation, focusing on validation of origin restrictions and secure data processing, including trusted domains.

items.title: Testing Browser Storage
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-012, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Evaluate the secure implementation and appropriate use of browser storage mechanisms (LocalStorage, SessionStorage, IndexedDB, Cookies) to prevent unauthorized access and data leakage.

items.title: Testing for Cross-Site Script Inclusion
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-013
items.description: Verify the application's resistance to the inclusion of malicious, externally hosted JavaScript code within its execution context.

items.title: Testing for Outdated JavaScript Dependency
items.description: Identify and assess outdated JavaScript dependencies for known vulnerabilities.

items.title: Testing for Dependency Confusion
items.description: Validate that the application's build process and package manager are configured to exclusively source internal dependencies from trusted, private registries, mitigating dependency confusion vulnerabilities.

steps.title: Upload logs
steps.description: This should include all associated traffic associated to the in-scope targets.

steps.title: Executive summary
steps.description: The executive summary should be written with a high-level view of both risk and business impact. It should be concise and clear, therefore it is important to use plain English. This ensures that non-technical readers can gain insight into security concerns outlined in your report.
